Name: Patrick Calvert
Description:
Patrick's body was found with a stab wound to the chest on the ramp of Interstate 55-70. A witness reported seeing their body being thrown from a vehicle.

> An East St. Louis [person] in women's clothing was found fatally stabbed after apparently being dumped on the ramp from St. Clair Avenue to the westbound lanes of Interstate 55-70, authorities report.
>
> St. Clair Coroner Rick Stone identi- fied the victim as Patrick Calvert, 30, of the 500 block of Washington Place.
>
> Stone said Calvert was pronounced dead shortly after 11 p.m. Wednesday in the emergency room at St. Mary's Hospital in East St. Louis. [They] had been stabbed once in the chest.
>
> Illinois State Police said they were called at 10:10 p.m. Wednesday by National City police, who reported finding Calvert lying on the ramp, critically injured and dressed in women's clothing.
>
> Police said an investigation had found Calvert had been walking along Illinois Route 3 in National City in an area frequented by [sex workers].
>
> They said [Patrick] was last seen getting into a gray or blue car with a dark colored stripe along the sides. A motorist later told National City police he saw a body pushed from a car on the St. Clair Avenue ramp.

Name: Tina Bernardes
Description:
Tina was found dead on a beach. She was dressed in women's clothing and had a bungee cord wrapped tightly around her neck. Ventura Jorge Rivera-Rios was convicted of the murder.

> Rivera-Rios, 27, is accused of killing [...] [trans woman] "Tina" Bernardes at Mokuleia Beach in the early morning hours of Aug. 30, 1991 after discovering Bernardes was [trans].

Tina's name was not included in the [archive of historic TDoR cases](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/10_JeZ7LEIRhvewTCoL5mVkH6MQJzf7fSXl4-P6QJ0v0/edit#gid=0) collated by tdor.info.
